item.title: Short answer, YES Long answer, HELL YES #FreeLunch4ALL
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Short answer, YES

Long answer, HELL YES

#FreeLunch4ALL

Denver7

The USDA is providing a second year of free school meals to public school students, and many advocates hope the change will be made permanent.

The USDA is providing a second year of free school meals to public school students, and many advocates hope the change will be made permanent.

Should school meals stay free for all kids permanently?

item.title: Today in our School Board retreat I plan to propose we add to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today in our School Board retreat I plan to propose we add to any language with ‚ÄúHe/She‚Äù in our policies and add ‚ÄúThey/Them‚Äù to ensure we are being inclusive to all.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today we return in-person for our School Board retreat so allow...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today we return in-person for our School Board retreat so allow me to share the poem I read this morning as I get ready for the day.

You may write me down in history
With your bitter, twisted lies,
You may trod me in the very dirt...
But still, like dust, I'll rise.

Does my sassiness upset you?
Why are you beset with gloom?
‚ÄôCause I walk like I've got oil wells
Pumping in my living room.

Just like moons and like suns,
With the certainty of tides,
Just like hopes springing high,
Still I'll rise.

Did you want to see me broken?
Bowed head and lowered eyes?
Shoulders falling down like teardrops,
Weakened by my soulful cries?

Does my haughtiness offend you?
Don't you take it awful hard
‚ÄôCause I laugh like I've got gold mines
Diggin‚Äô in my own backyard.

You may shoot me with your words,
You may cut me with your eyes,
You may kill me with your hatefulness,
But still, like air, I‚Äôll rise.

Does my sexiness upset you?
Does it come as a surprise
That I dance like I've got diamonds
At the meeting of my thighs?

Out of the huts of history‚Äôs shame, I rise
Up from a past that‚Äôs rooted in pain, I rise
I'm a black ocean, leaping and wide,
Welling and swelling I bear in the tide.

Leaving behind nights of terror and fear, I rise
Into a daybreak that‚Äôs wondrously clear, I rise
Bringing the gifts that my ancestors gave,
I am the dream and the hope of the slave.

I rise
I rise
I rise.

- Maya Angelou

See More

item.title: School districts should just add masks to the ‚Äúdress code‚Äù...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

School districts should just add masks to the ‚Äúdress code‚Äù so conservatives would have to take their fight out on district dress codes.

Then we can agree there are some items that don‚Äôt belong in the dress code.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver has now moved to RED ‚Ä¶ and y‚Äôall want to fight about...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver has now moved to RED ‚Ä¶ and y‚Äôall want to fight about masks in schools?
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Here is the simple fix to not wanting your child to wear a mask...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Here is the simple fix to not wanting your child to wear a mask in schools, keep them at home.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Denver Public Schools will implement a universal mask mandate....
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools will implement a universal mask mandate. This will be enforced in all INDOOR settings. I am grateful our teams in DPS have decided to follow the science and recommendations from the CDC.

This is our opportunity to be a leader in the fight against COVID!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Yes it‚Äôs great 70% of eligible Americans have received the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Yes it‚Äôs great 70% of eligible Americans have received the vaccine, but that 30% is what is holding us back. We can not have the privileges we once had if they do not get vaccinated.

Until then I support masking up indoors and various entities requiring vaccinations.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: UPDATE ‚Äî REGARDING MASKING IN DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS: Mayor...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

UPDATE ‚Äî REGARDING MASKING IN DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS:

Mayor Hancock‚Äôs new order requiring all city employees and those working in high-risk areas to be vaccinated, has delayed DPS‚Äô announcement regarding COVID guidance for the fall semester.

Look for an update again tomorrow.
item.author: Tay Anderson

Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Happy Birthday Colorado!

145 Years Strong! ‚Äî In order to celebrate without wearing masks next year, get vaccinated!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: My request for restorative justice at the upcoming School Board...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

My request for restorative justice at the upcoming School Board retreat on August 10th has been denied at this time.

This is disappointing, however it is imperative to hold space for healing. I will continue to request that the Board of Education hold space for this to happen prior to the beginning of the school year.

Now I need community to email the Board of Education showing your support for restorative justice.

...

Our email is ‚Äî Board@dpsk12.org

We need board members who are willing to have tough conversations, engage and involve the community and Denver educators and are willing to adopt policies that ...bring about positive change.

We trust that these three community builders will continue their work for our children on the board and add a great deal of experience and expertise.

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I do not agree with this opinion, those Charter school networks...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I do not agree with this opinion, those Charter school networks SHOULD pay back the funding they received. ‚Äî The goal was to help small businesses stay afloat and keep their workers employed during the pandemic. Charter schools already had funding to pay employees.

This is why it is important to have a School Board directly engaging with community members.

Charter critics initially balked at the independent schools getting the loan money, but district officials said the issue is "not in the crosshairs as much as it was."

co.chalkbeat.org

Amid influx of new funding, Denver district not pursuing true-up with charter schools that got small business loans

Charter critics initially balked at the independent schools getting the loan money, but district officials said the issue is "not in the crosshairs as much as it was."Charter critics initially balked at the independent schools getting the loan money, but district officials said the issue is "not in the crosshairs as much as it was."
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I know many parents are waiting on COVID guidance from Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I know many parents are waiting on COVID guidance from Denver Public Schools.

The Board of Education doesn‚Äôt enact these plans, however I‚Äôve spoken to the Superintendent and he is actively working with public health officials to decide what to do.

We SHOULD have the information you‚Äôre seeking next week!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: There isn‚Äôt a microchip, you won‚Äôt become a zombie, the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

There isn‚Äôt a microchip, you won‚Äôt become a zombie, the government isn‚Äôt trying to track you, get the COVID-19 vaccine.

It‚Äôs SAFE for everyone regardless of who you love, how you identify, the color of your skin, and party affiliation.

#GetVaccinatedNow
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today I sent this open letter to my colleagues on the Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I sent this open letter to my colleagues on the Denver School Board in regards to my future on the DPS School Board.

Warning: This letter discusses my battle with depression and contemplating suicide.

National Suicide Hotline: (800-273-8255)

This letter was sent to the Denver School Board in regards to the important work ahead.

link.medium.com

Let‚Äôs get back to work ‚Äî An open letter to the Denver School Board; Director Tay Anderson

This letter was sent to the Denver School Board in regards to the important work ahead.This letter was sent to the Denver School Board in regards to the important work ahead.
item.author: Tay Anderson
